metadata.title: CVE-2021-20292 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description: There is a flaw reported in the Linux kernel in versions before 5.9 indrivers/gpu/drm/nouveau/nouveau_sgdma.c in nouveau_sgdma_create_ttm inNouveau DRM subsystem. The issue results from the lack of validating theexistence of an object prior to performing operations on the object. Anattacker with a local account with a root privilege, can leverage thisvulnerability to escalate privileges and execute code in the context of thekernel.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
